content.title: PAD Definition
content.definition: Peripheral arterial disease is atherosclerotic narrowing/occlusion of arteries supplying the lower extremities.
content.statement: PAD Definition is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Pad that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding PAD Definition helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of PAD Definition include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of PAD Definition.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
